2025-11-21ECCC, HCCanadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999Regulations Amending the Multi-Sector Air Pollutants Regulations Regulations Amending the Multi-Sector Air Pollutants Regulations in order to (1) extend the deadline to carry a nitrogen oxides (NOx) test to reclassify pre-existing boilers and heaters until December 31, 2025; (2) provide flexibility to boilers and heaters operating conditions during testing as well as to test duration requirements, when there is a demonstrated safety risk to equipment or to human life; (3) provide flexibilities to NOx re-testing requirements when the concentration of methane in the fuel change; (4) eliminate unnecessary port hole location requirements; (5) remove the requirement that the rated capacity be set at the commissioning date of the boiler or heater; (6) add provisions to conduct a NOx test for boilers and heaters connected to a common stack; (7) add provisions to allow the classification of a shut-in boiler or heater that would come back in service after January 1st, 2026; and (8) add GPA Midstream Association methodologies GPA 2286 and GPA 2261 as accepted methods to test fuel methane content.Registration: SOR/2025-0229 Publication Date: 2025-12-03
subject: Regulations Amending the Multi-Sector Air Pollutants Regulations
precis: Regulations Amending the Multi-Sector Air Pollutants Regulations in order to (1) extend the deadline to carry a nitrogen oxides (NOx) test to reclassify pre-existing boilers and heaters until December 31, 2025; (2) provide flexibility to boilers and heaters operating conditions during testing as well as to test duration requirements, when there is a demonstrated safety risk to equipment or to human life; (3) provide flexibilities to NOx re-testing requirements when the concentration of methane in the fuel change; (4) eliminate unnecessary port hole location requirements; (5) remove the requirement that the rated capacity be set at the commissioning date of the boiler or heater; (6) add provisions to conduct a NOx test for boilers and heaters connected to a common stack; (7) add provisions to allow the classification of a shut-in boiler or heater that would come back in service after January 1st, 2026; and (8) add GPA Midstream Association methodologies GPA 2286 and GPA 2261 as accepted methods to test fuel methane content.
